material.mattext: What does MIMO stand for in telecommunications?
What is the primary benefit of using MIMO technology?
Which of the following describes the concept of spatial multiplexing in MIMO?
Transmitting different data streams from multiple antennas
Using a single antenna for multiple signals
High-Speed Packet Access (HSPA) is an enhancement of which mobile communication standard?
What is the main purpose of HSPA in mobile networks?
Which technology combines both HSDPA and HSUPA?
Long-Term Evolution (LTE) is often referred to as which generation of mobile communication?
What is the main advantage of LTE over its predecessors?
Higher data throughput and lower latency
Which of the following technologies is an evolution of LTE?
What does the term 'carrier aggregation' refer to in LTE-Advanced?
Combining multiple frequency bands to increase data rates
Splitting a single frequency band into multiple channels
Reducing the number of carriers in the network
What does OFDMA stand for in LTE?
Which feature of LTE helps in reducing latency?
Improvement in signal reliability by using multiple antennas
What is 'beamforming' in the context of MIMO technology?
Directing the signal towards specific users using multiple antennas
In HSPA, what does the term 'Enhanced Uplink' refer to?
Improved data rates for uplink transmissions
Which component is essential for achieving high data rates in LTE?
What is the primary goal of LTE-Advanced?
Increase data rates and network capacity
Which of the following is a key feature of HSPA+?
In MIMO systems, what is 'channel state information' (CSI)?
Information about the signal path and quality
What does the term 'spectral efficiency' refer to in LTE?
The amount of data transmitted over a given bandwidth
The frequency of the signal transmission
The power consumption of the network
Which technology uses 'adaptive modulation and coding' to enhance performance?
What is the purpose of 'HARQ' in LTE?
To ensure reliable data transmission through error correction
Which component of LTE architecture connects the base station to the core network?
In MIMO technology, 'spatial diversity' helps in:
Combating signal fading and improving reliability
What is the role of the 'eNodeB' in LTE networks?
Serving as the base station for wireless communication
Which of the following is an advantage of using HSPA over traditional 3G?
What does 'scalable bandwidth' mean in the context of LTE?
The ability to adjust the bandwidth to meet different data rate requirements
The frequency of the signal transmission
The power consumption of the network
In LTE, what is the function of the 'Serving Gateway' (SGW)?
Routing data packets within the core network
